Complete Topic - Heroes, Martyrs and their Cults in Latin America
Throughout Latin American history, heroes and martyrs have played a crucial role in the creation of unifying national narratives. At the same time, they have often become the source of discord, as different groups disagreed over what and who should be remembered as heroic and exemplary. This course will explore some of these debates by focusing on the representation of exemplary lives in the region through a variety of means, including fiction, photography, monuments, museums, archives, ceremonials, and rituals. Among the topics to be addressed are: modernity, nation building, social rebellion, and accountability.
